content.question:
This question is a short free-response question. Show your work for each part of the question.

(<math alttext="7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> points, suggested time <math alttext="13" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes)

Identical blocks <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> are placed on a horizontal surface at points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively, as shown. The surface is frictionless except for the region between points <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, where the surface is rough. Beginning at time <math alttext="t sub A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is pushed with a constant horizontal force from point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> by a mechanical plunger. Upon reaching point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> loses contact with the plunger and continues moving to the right along the horizontal surface toward block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> collides with and sticks to block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> at point <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, after which the two-block system continues moving across the surface, eventually passing point <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a) On the axes below, sketch the speed of the center of mass of the two-block system as a function of time, from time <math alttext="t sub A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> until the blocks pass point <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at time <math alttext="t sub F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The times at which block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> reaches points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> through <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are indicated on the time axis.

frqParts.text:
This question is a short free-response question. Show your work for each part of the question.

(<math alttext="7" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> points, suggested time <math alttext="13" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes)

Identical blocks <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> are placed on a horizontal surface at points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, respectively, as shown. The surface is frictionless except for the region between points <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, where the surface is rough. Beginning at time <math alttext="t sub A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is pushed with a constant horizontal force from point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> by a mechanical plunger. Upon reaching point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> loses contact with the plunger and continues moving to the right along the horizontal surface toward block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> collides with and sticks to block <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> at point <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, after which the two-block system continues moving across the surface, eventually passing point <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(a) On the axes below, sketch the speed of the center of mass of the two-block system as a function of time, from time <math alttext="t sub A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>A</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> until the blocks pass point <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> at time <math alttext="t sub F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>. The times at which block <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> reaches points <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> through <math alttext="F" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>F</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> are indicated on the time axis.

(b) The plunger is returned to its original position, and both blocks are removed. A uniform solid sphere is placed at point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, as shown. The sphere is pushed by the plunger from point <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> with a constant horizontal force that is directed toward the sphere’s center of mass. The sphere loses contact with the plunger at point <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and continues moving across the horizontal surface toward point <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. In which interval(s), if any, does the sphere’s angular momentum about its center of mass change? Check all that apply.

<math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>      <math alttext="B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>B</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>      <math alttext="C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>      <math alttext="D" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>D</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="E" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>E</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>      None

skill.text: 1.C: Create qualitative sketches of graphs that represent features of a model or the behavior of a physical system.
